steps.title: Assess the Situation
steps.description: Make sure the area is safe, then check the person’s responsiveness by gently shaking their shoulder and asking loudly, 'Are you okay?'

steps.title: Call for Help
steps.description: Ask someone nearby to call emergency services, or call yourself immediately.

steps.title: Open Airway
steps.description: Place the person on their back, tilt the head back and lift the chin to open the airway.

steps.title: Check Breathing
steps.description: Look, listen, and feel for normal breathing for no more than 10 seconds.

steps.title: Start Chest Compressions
steps.description: Place your hands in the center of the chest and push hard and fast (100–120 compressions per minute).

steps.title: Rescue Breaths (if trained)
steps.description: Give 2 rescue breaths after every 30 compressions if you are trained and feel safe.

steps.title: Continue CPR
steps.description: Keep going until medical help arrives or the person shows signs of recovery.
